Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is encrusted with a brown-yellow resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and very faint traces of a number of lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394569) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394569)
